channel.title: Vidviews on Vidhance Support
channel.description: Recent content in Vidviews on Vidhance Support

item.title: Vidview SDK
item.description:
This page contains support resources for Imint’s Vidview product.

Prerequisites

System requirements

Vidview requires Windows 7, .NET 4.0 and a GPU from NVidia, ATI/AMD or an Intel HD Graphics 3000 or better.

License Key

In order to use Vidhance video enhancements and/or extra video codecs you need a license key which is used to request a license for the computer you run on.

Considerations

What to consider before starting the integration of the Vidview SDK are outlined in the Vidview Integration Considerations (pdf) document.

Installing

Vidview is distributed in two ways:

Installer
Installing using the installer is suitable for running the demo application and for integrations using TCP/IP.
NuGet
Using NuGet to get Vidview is suitable when integrating into .NET applications using Visual Studio.

Installer

The installation process is described in the Vidview SDK Demo Installation Guide (pdf).

NuGet

Using NuGet to get Vidview is suitable when integrating into .NET applications using Visual Studio.

Instructions are included in the Vidview .NET SDK Getting Started Guide (pdf).

Usage

There are several ways to use Vidview. Please consult the Vidview Integration Considerations (pdf) document for details.

Vidview Demo Application
Vidview SDK Demo Installation Guide (pdf)
Vidview .NET SDK
Vidview .NET SDK Getting Started Guide (pdf)
Vidview TCP SDK
Vidview TCP SDK Getting Started Guide (pdf)
Vidview Media Guide
Vidview Media Guide (pdf)
Vidview License Management Guide
Vidview License Management Guide

Examples

Examples on how to use specific parts of the Vidview SDK are available at http://github.com/vidview. Please do request more examples as needed.
